p: Although most cases presented with fever, 7% never developed fever throughout their illness. Fever was an important clue for detecting imported cases. Significant reduction of lymphopenia and CD4+T lymphopenia as well as ground-glass lesions on CT images appeared in most patients at admission, supporting the three clinical criteria i.e. fever/respiratory symptoms, leukopenia and/or lymphopenia, and typical pulmonary imaging findings, for diagnosis of suspected COVID-19 [ 6]. We also found that CT imaging helped classify disease severity as a larger proportion of scans from critically ill patients revealed bilateral lung involvement compared with mild cases. Data from previous studies indicating a superior sensitivity of RT-PCR in the early infection phase (0â€“2 days) compared with chest CT (97% vs 44%) demonstrated the importance of ensuring an adequate supply of RT-PCR services in outbreak control [ 11].
